website_summaries.verdict: This quality Japanese quartz watch can charge in both natural and indoor light, so it's a great pick whether you're an outdoorsmen or an office-dweller.
pros: Charges in sunlight or indoor light
Stainless steel case with black dial and date window
Stitched canvas band with buckle closure
Works for swimming and snorkeling, but not diving
cons: May need to remember to charge for a few minutes once a week if you usually wear long sleeves over it

website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a watch that you can confidently wear in wet conditions, this one by a name known for quality is built to impress without overextending your bank account.
pros: Sturdy, casual, and built to last
Has Japanese quartz movement and date window
Comes with an excellent 5-year warranty – all this for a reasonable price
cons: Some owners found the canvas strap uncomfortable
The dial is on the small side, and the illuminating function doesn't work well in all lighting

customer_reviews.title: A sound Timekeeper
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful watch, & suitable for years of use. I live a VERY active life: hiking trails through states, climbing, snorkeling & diving, working with knives & cutlery, mechanic bays, etc. Quite varied & this watch has taken all of the abuse. Excellent craftsmanship by Citizen. With all of the abuse I gave this watch in my 20's, only some scratches on the Quartz face tell the story. The band is just about disintegrated (after 4 years of full use). Overall, this is definitely a watch I would wear in the field, & in casual environments. I additionally like the option of Spanish days for the day calendar. A sound Timekeeper.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Asana

customer_reviews.title: The watch is not water resistant.
customer_reviews.text: The watch is not water resistant. The water go inside my watch after 10 months normal use.
customer_reviews.author: FYX

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I owned it 3 days and the Day function stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Guaranteed buyer

customer_reviews.title: Love the design so sad that a Citizen would make ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 9 months...Love the design so sad that a Citizen would make such a poor watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not a Full Day...
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, not even a full day's use and the day feature does not work!
customer_reviews.author: MAB

customer_reviews.title: Beef
customer_reviews.text: Used this watch on a deployment to Afghanistan. I chose this watch because of the solar battery, and it worked great. Illumination is pretty decent, last till about 1 am or so. Mines all scratched but It took a pretty hard beating and still use it daily. I changed out the band of course, I used a 18mm timex nylon band I had. Only complaints are I wish it had 24hr markings instead of seconds markings , and if you change the date while the hands are in the upper portion of the dial it screws it all up. Solar worked great though and never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zergface

customer_reviews.title: Way too small for a Men’s watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is described as a Men’s watch however in reality it looks more like a female watch. Especially with the thin band. If you’ve got thin arms and wrists or have female esque features, maybe this watch will suit you. But if you’re a mans man, go with something else from Citizen like the Eco Drive Diver.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Best. Watch. Ever. (Also, completely silent and good for a notsobig wrist.)
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch more than is healthy. It's simple and best of all, completely silent. No ticking at all. My wrists aren't exactly gigantic either, so it's nice not to look like I'm wearing a dinner plate on my arm. I did swap out the band with a Barton band (which I'd suggest) not only for the looks, but also because the band that it came with was extremely stiff and uncomfortable. But this is a review of the watch, not the band.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Petite Woman Looking for a Handsome Watch
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch. I have a 5.5 inch wrist and have a hard time finding a decent ladies watch that has a field look to it that doesn't break the bank. I have a small timex but couldn't find anyone who makes a leather strap with a buckle- so I tried this watch as an upgrade intending to also purchase a leather strap from Etsy. The nylon strap that comes with this watch is a pain and left terrible marks all over my wrist- minus a star. It's a little heavy for my petite wrist but looks good without being overly "boyfriend" looking. The date is a definite plus compared to my timex weekender.
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice

customer_reviews.title: Watch face melted...
customer_reviews.text: When I received the watch, the face was slightly distorted. Only wear it on the weekends. Came home from the grocery store Sunday and notice the time was way off. Face is distorted to the point the hour hand is dragging on the watch face. Contacted Citizen, they are accepting for repair. Will improve rating if repair is free. Otherwise I was loving the watch up until the face melted. April update: Citizen fixed the watch for free after saying they wouldn't.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Keck

customer_reviews.title: The watch is awesome. The strap sucks
customer_reviews.text: The watch is awesome. The strap sucks, I knew that going in. Ordered a custom 18mm Horween leather strap for it, fits perfectly and really makes the watch feel and look much, much better.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: A watch that doesn't fade overnight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch mostly for its luminous dial. I wanted a watch that would stay luminous through the night and it works as promised. Without more than ordinary daytime exposure, the hands still remain clearly visible after 8 hours in the dark. The numbers are no so clear, being somewhat faded by morning. But that is good enough for me. It keeps time well and the days of the week can be in Spanish or English. The band is not my style and I bought an 18mm wide replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Hamish

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, but the charging is not true.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look of this watch, but it is now less than two years since I purchased this watch and it needs a new "capacitor" which I believe must actually be a battery. I had to send it off for a "capacitor" replacement as it started losing several minutes a day. The cost of the replacement is about $75. I don't believe that this watch really charges because it needs a new battery after only two years. I have been wearing this watch daily for the past few months so its inability to keep a charge is not because it has not been in the light.
customer_reviews.author: MarkH

customer_reviews.title: BM8180 is an excellent watch for the $
customer_reviews.text: Really like the BM8180 - but have a few gripes. The strap pins click & move around, as if they aren’t the right size. I have ordered Barton spring pins (1.8mm) so hopefully the issue gets resolved. Also this watch case is only 37mm. Might be too small for some people. I’m 5’10”/180lbs & a 40mm case is great...42mm is too big. Keeping this Citizen eco-drive watch, as it is a good looking field watch, but a bit miffed about the loose strap pin situation. The straps however are super cool canvas w/metal eyelets - should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: matt cecil

customer_reviews.title: A simple watch
customer_reviews.text: I have a few watches but realized I really only need to know the time and date. For most of my needs, I do not need 8 time zones, stop watches, timers, 1000m water resistance, a compass, or an altimeter. Sometimes, simplicity is best and this watch achieves that. I will say that that face is a bit small compared to mens watches of today. With my wrists, I wear the strap at the last eyelet, making the watch face appear small on my wrist. Nevertheless, the simplistic design is what draws me to this watch. The price is great and I'll keep this watch in rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R.

customer_reviews.title: It is working it's way into being my watch
customer_reviews.text: I am particular about time because of work. This watch at first was off the UTC over the first few weeks, but the other day it checked to be still on time to the second. I am hopeful that it just needed a period of time to work the mechanism into it's final working operation. It is easy to read in daylight at night the hands are visible except the second hand although it seems that whenever I check the day/date the minute hand blocks the view. I wonder what it is about me and the time I check it?
customer_reviews.author: Flicker

customer_reviews.title: Not sized for men, good for kids, must buy new band, this one is cheap
customer_reviews.text: caused my arm to break out in a rash. the size is fit for a child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: day function stopped working after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: day function stopped working after two weeks - disappointing to say the least for this price
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Gal

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken. Day of the week stuck on the calender.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great for not-so-girly ladies too!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a watch large enough to see and tough enough to wear every day: something not easy to find in the world of tiny, dainty women's watches. This one fits my 6.5 inch wrist just fine. I originally planned to replace the band right away, but the green is less prominent than in the description and comfortable enough that I don't mind it. The band fits me perfectly on the 2nd to the smallest hole, so it is pretty adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Bluskyz

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this watch and is classic style display the canvas band has a leather liner on the bottom side and compliments the watch well and has sturdy feel to the band I've had the watch 1 month and set it to the digital time on my tablet and is still exact to the second I purchased this watch for casual wear and I've not abused it at all beside dropping it to the floor a few times also the illumination is acceptable but fades after dark. Over all I'm very happy with this watch.
customer_reviews.author: CrackerJack

customer_reviews.title: This is made of Aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Citizen sure is going downhill fast. This is the first Eco-drive I've had that looks and feels like a cheap woman's watch. That's probably because it's now made in China. This thing is too thin and fragile to be a 'men's field watch,' and the chrome air-spray paint on the case makes this thing good for signaling aircraft in an emergency situation. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: T. D.

customer_reviews.title: Basic clasic design...large numbers...solar powered
customer_reviews.text: This kind of reminded me of a watch that was a knock off of a Russian military watch. More in line with being a utilitarian watch. It's got large numbers. I find the date and day a bit harder to read unless I'm wearing my reading glasses or in brightly lit situations. I did see the details of the watch band before I purchased this watch and decided to order another band to replace. See pics and link. We'll see how the solar power battery holds up, figured that my wife had a Seiko and this Citizen coming from the same gene pool...it'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice automatic watch but....
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch for about a year and a half. I wear it as an everyday watch . The price was right and it’s a smart looking watch that keeps perfect time. The day and date. That’s all I need. My complaints are about the face of this watch. Cheap plastic something or other crystal material and the surrounding ring of the lense. It has several scratches in the lense and the chrome is wearing off. I’ve had lots of watches over the years and this is a first. It looks like it’s got about ten years on it. You’ll get a lot more durable lense on a thirty dollar timex.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Haas

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: I was scared when I opened the box, and the watch was jumping 2 seconds at a time. I put the watch in the direct sun for a literal second, and the watch was immediately normal. No issues since. I think the watch was just on a really low charge. I do not take this watch off ever. Takes the abuse and then some. Great build quality, never needs a battery replacement. I can see this watch easily lasting me the rest of my life. Also, very impressed my the watches night glow. Lasts all night so I can read the face at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff kornowski

customer_reviews.title: GREAT purchase
customer_reviews.text: Likes: - Super clear to read - Not too big, not to small for a 6.5inch wrist - Solar and super accurate... - Very clean looking watch (match it with a black Nato strap with stainless steel buckles and it will look like it came from the factory that way) Dislikes: - Would of liked it to come w/ sapphire with a higher price point - You will want to change the straps... but everyone does that eventually - nothing else really...
customer_reviews.author: Yuji

customer_reviews.title: Best watch I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is my second identical watch. I lost the first one, tried another brand and style (cheaper) but felt as though nothing could replace my eco-drive Citizens watch. It's a perfect, tough and easily readable watch. Sunlight and indoor lighting charges it faultlessly. I'm a woman and I need glasses to read but another plus is that it's large enough that I can see it without corrective lens. I garden a lot and do other jobs around the house and want a job that can take some rough and tumble. This watch checks all the boxes for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. T. K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great. I bought it after my battery watch stopped working (that one not bought on Amazon). I found this solar watch here which also doesn't have a metal band that would need to be taken to a watchmaker to remove some of the links (an extra cost) or needing a new battery every so often. I am very glad I bought this nice looking watch that works so well. I don't skin dive, so I haven't tried the 100 meter deep waterproof capabilities listed for it, but I'll take the advert's word for it.
customer_reviews.author: qqviewer231

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she loved it. I INCORRECTLY gave a bad review by mistake. I was referring to another product. I have tried to change or trash that review and I hope I was successful. Your watch and your business are 5 stars by my standard. I'm not that good at computers I apologize for my previous incorrect 1 star review. People should know you are a good reputable business. I hope to do business with you in the future. Please stay healthy happy and I hope forgiving.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, terrible warrantee registration
customer_reviews.text: My last Citizen eco-drive lasted about 15 years. This one seems just as good. Love the clean watch face, lack of distracting and unnecessary features. The band isn't great, but I knew that going in. My one gripe: the online registration is TERRIBLE. It requires a serial number, model number and "caliber" number that are almost impossible to read, even with a magnifying glass. I registered, but have no clue if the information I entered is correct. 5 stars except for that!
customer_reviews.author: James D. Besser

customer_reviews.title: I gifted it out.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is an accurate time piece for people who like a tiny thin watch. I wore it for a few days but the nylon band becomes scratchy and irritating after 4 or 5 hrs. So rather than spend any more money for a better band, I gifted it out to a needy person. It's odd they installed such fat watch hands on such a small watch face. I just couldnt get used to trying to read it at a glance. But the person who now owns it is thrilled !!! It just wasnt my bag of tea.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, excellent performance, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Only had this watch for a couple of weeks but pleased so far. Returned a Seiko automatic watch that was losing 2 minutes per week. This is staying on time so far. Some have complained that the bezel on this watch scratches easily. I’ve worn Timex watches all my life and never really noticed them getting scratched, but I bought the screen protectors for this watch just in case.
customer_reviews.author: J. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Size is great, switched out band immediately as is was difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: Size is great, switched out band immediately as is was difficult to put on and take off and grommets very uncomfortable. Got a couple simple nylon bands and a nato band and they all are an improvement. My husband noticed immediately that the crystal had several scratches which were not mentioned in description. The only thing that was supposed to be an issue was the packaging. Think I was sent wrong watch as it was scratched, had not paperwork or instructions or warranty information but the box was perfect. At reduced price, I chose to keep and give to husband and hope I made right decision.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: I liked the watch but the strap was detached/ripped from the end, it is a minor defect and can be changed but I would have liked it to come perfect because I liked the color. UPDATE: I found that my watch was moving forward 5-6 minutes every half hour or 1 hour several times a day. I don't know if that's the watch or just mine.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, just not quite what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at roughly the same time as my Seiko SNZG15 thinking that they would be pretty similar. I suppose that's an unfair comparison... I expected more... The lume is not very bright and is virtually unreadable after about 30 minutes. It looks... ok... It seems to be holding up well and it seems to be very accurate. It's just a little smaller than I expected and I had hoped for much better lume.
customer_reviews.author: Sambeaux

customer_reviews.title: What a great watch!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is exactly what I was looking for. I love just about everything about it. It keeps time well, has a lot of features without being cluttered, and a nice appearance without being flashy. I like that it's not necessary to worry about changing batteries. I've had it for a year now and I really love it. The one thing I might change about this watch is that, although the dials are glow-in-the-dark, the watch can sometimes be hard to read in the dark. So it might not be the best for those who work outdoors at night.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Turner

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Got mine in 2012. Looks like it was made in Japan. Keeps time perfectly - the only time I turn the crown is when I have to adjust the hour for daylight saving. Howeverk I don't bother adjusting the date. No noticeable blemishes in 8 years. Granted, I wear another watch now mostly, but this is a nice, classy, minimalist change of pace. Frankly I'll leave it on the windowsill and just let it bask in the sun and charge all the time. Makes a nice accent piece next to a plant!
customer_reviews.author: sifelaver

customer_reviews.title: Great watch with excellent warranty. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it about a month and really like it. It's my second eco drive. The first one is great. Still going strong. 5 year warranty and no battery replacement. Note: these don't charge well on the window sill and obviously won't charge in a drawer. Very easy to read. I thought my old one was broken and sent it in. They recharged it and sent it back free. My bad! Has day and date but small, which I prefer. The band is ok but sort of military looking on this watch. Easily exchanged. Eco drive watches cost more but that is offset by no battery replacement. This one is a slightly smaller mans size and very comfortable. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Beans

customer_reviews.title: A very simple watch but it's solar powered so there are no batteries to replace.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple watch with not a lot of extras. Also, I wanted a casual looking, every day watch that didn't need the batteries replaced every so often. I got what I wanted and so far, the watch has performed well. I like the style and the only extra is the date/time display. I love the watchband and the black background, radium numbers on the watch's face suit me to a T. Admittedly, I've only had this watch for about a month but so far I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyK4372

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, well made, classic watch
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a well made, basic watch, that told good time and date, and this is exactly what I got. The watch is eco-friendly in that it never needs a battery..........presuming you do not live in a cave and never go outside. Just needs a bit of sunshine to keep it running. And, it is rugged, and will last a long time. I gave it a 4 because I am not crazy about the band. Not the most comfortable, stylish, or the best color (green). But,. it is easily changeable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago. Keeping track using an atomic clock, it gains a second a week. That's about as accurate as I could wish for. I can wear it at the pool without worries. It's lightweight, fairly rugged, and good looking. The numbers are easy to read. Setting the day, and date is standard for watches with those complications, and not having to worry about winding it, or replacing the batteries is a joy. I did have to replace the band because I have big wrists, but, other than that, I have no complaints. I, also, like the size. It's unobtrusive and good looking. A perfect watch for me.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Kurka

customer_reviews.title: This has become my daily watch
customer_reviews.text: I will admit I am partial to Casio watches and have a few which work fine. I thought I would try this Citizen and if I liked it I would consider the more expensive options they make. The watch is very comfortable on the wrist, not large, and the black face is legible. It retains a charge very well. The cloth band if a concern as it has started to show a little wear after a short time. The more expensive Citizen models set the date where it has to be done manually on this watch. It only takes a few minutes but I am spoiled with the Casio solar watches which do all of this automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Albert R.

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Citizen Eco Drive. The first one lasted 14 years and still running perfect. This new one looks good, though it is stainless steel, not much heavier compares to my old titanium eco drive. After use it for 2 weeks, found that the watch only luminate on the hour, minute hands and the 12 o'clock position, and the luminance is weaker than my 14 years old titanium eco drive. disappointing 26 Jan 2020 revised After using this watch for 3 months, I must say I am annoyed by the weak luminance of the hands - degraded rapidly. Besides that, all functioning well. I therefore reduce to 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Ying Kit Yeung

customer_reviews.title: Date/Day indicator issue
customer_reviews.text: First hung I noticed on this one is the date indication. Seems like it does not align with the day itself. The number is a bit lower. I’ve had watches that has both a date and day indicator and this one is a bit off. I ordered another one just in case it’s just that one watch that’s a bit defective. But the 2nd one has the same exact “defect”. Is this normal? Other than that, watch is decent.
customer_reviews.author: 3LR

customer_reviews.title: Eco-drive!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of these (identical) Citizen watches. Eco-drive is fantastic. So is the water resistance. I wear it in the shower and never give it a thought. I bought this one only because the band was wearing out after several years and I had badly scratched the crystal doing yard work. The older one is still running fine, though. Love the watch.
customer_reviews.author: LT-Auburn

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Have not had watch very long but seems very nice when you consider the price. Never have opened an eco drive but the fact that the watch never needs a battery is a plus for me. Time will tell how well if holds up since I do not where it very much. Some reviews gave so so comment on the band but I think the band is ok and looks nicer than the picture shows...
customer_reviews.author: steve c.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, the band is a little wonky
customer_reviews.text: This Citizen watch looks great and you can read the face easily. The band is a little awkward at first, but I was able to get used to it after a couple wears. I wear this watch around 2-3 times a week for the work day (I work in an indoor office with florescent bulbs) and it keeps the charge well. I feel like this particular watch has more of a sporty look compared to the Citizen watches. Certainly one that I can wear in and out of work.
customer_reviews.author: M_217

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy this watch
customer_reviews.text: I like the styling of this watch, but of course, that's subjective. The eco drive is terrific. The battery isn't going to fail when least expected because it's solar. I wasn't sure I'd like the band, based on the pictures. When I received the watch, I discovered the band is more finely crafted than the pictures suggested, and it's fairly stiff and solid. If I lost this watch, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bylenga

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality watch for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: The fit and finish is of a watch of a much higher price. I've only owned it for six months so I can't speak for longevity. But having had another Citizen Eco-Drive for five years, I think it's safe to say that this watch will perform the same. I only paid $91, which considering you don't have inconvenience and cost of replacing the battery is very cheap in my opinion. What I really like is the fact that it's water resistant to 330 feet. It's also completely accurate. I would highly recommend this watch, and they also have many other Eco-Drive models. And, no, I haven't been paid by Citizen to give this review.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Daly

customer_reviews.title: attractive, smaller case a plus
customer_reviews.text: Clean, attractive, smaller case size a plus in my opinion, easy to recharge and keeps great time. It has become my daily wear watch - even with the original strap, which I had intended to change out based on reviews here, but have grown to appreciate with a little breaking in. A quality Citizen watch for under $100 - what's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: MCastellon

customer_reviews.title: Decent watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: First citizen watch. Nice looking watch, though the face is little smaller than I was expecting so if your wrist is above average size, it may be too small. Fit and finish is ok though the seconds hand do not align with the numbers. The strap looks nice and seems solid but the metal gromets tend to catch when putting on so that may irritate some. I have only worn the watch for a few days so can’t yet attest to it’s durability or how the crystal holds up to scratches. I got the watch on sale for less than $60 and at that price, the watch is fine but don’t know that it is worth more.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch and it's a perfect women's watch. If you're like me and not a girly girl who loves the outdoors then this watch is a great idea for you. It's easy to read and the band while a bit stiff at first is really simple and easy to wear. So happy I bought this. Though heads up the watch does not come with an instruction manual and citizen will tell you to install an app, don't bother but just online and read the instructions there.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Paal

customer_reviews.title: A very nice timepiece
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after being disappointing by my Sieko 5. Had 2 Seiko 5's that eventually wouldn't keep time properly. I am a firefighter and we have to have accurate time records and work around a lot of water and this watch takes a beating and is always keeps time within a fraction of a second over month's and month's of time. I recommend getting the 5 pack of watch face protectors, they work great and keep the crystal scratch free
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I am a maintenance man and am really hard on my watches. The second day i smacked it on a door hinge on a fire door I had removed and it did not scratch! I have owned their much more expensive versions and this is no different in quality. It is a lot more simple and easy to use though. My last Citizen broke its band (during extremely hard use) and it did cost me a hundred dollar bill and had to send it back to them to fix, with this I can use whatever band I wish which is a MAJOR plus.
customer_reviews.author: Scouter

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and no more batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this watch recently and so far I am very happy with it. It seems to keep very accurate time and easy to read for this older guy. I find it comfortable to wear however if you have a large wrist the band seems better suited for regular or smaller wrist. I think I am about average and it works well. I would recommend this watch to anyone looking for a good watch at a decent price. I am extremely happy to be free of batteries once and for all.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Holladay

customer_reviews.title: It is just right!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple inexpensive field watch that would free me from buying replacement batteries every 2 years or so. This exceeded my expectations. It is solar powered with up to a 6 month reserve once fully sharged. I don't have big wrists so the diameter was just right. The band is excellent. It has rivets in the holes so your usual hole that will be used for a long time won't be worn out. It is not leather so one's sweat won't discolor it and eventually break it down. The contrast and lettering is such that it's easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The dial is not huge for a smaller female wrist but is easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I am hard on watches. The dial is not huge for a smaller female wrist but is easy to read, even at night. It is easy to set and register for a 6 year warranty-just go online. It looks utilitarian, doesn't catch on anything and runs great without winding, jiggling or replacing the battery. It can go seamlessly from daily ranch work to nightly casual outings. No muss, no fuss, good brand, inexpensive and hopefully will keep running longer than me. My kind of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: g cramer

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad watch
customer_reviews.text: Got a good deal, but they didn’t say it was used. The clockhands are supposed to glow in the dark but they don’t which I’m bummed I can’t tell the time in the dark. Love that it’s water resistant. I bumped it swimming in the ocean and the band snapped off which I was bummed about but luckily I found it and put the band back on. I do like that it tells the date I do like that it shows the numbers for the minute hand. It’s a decent watch over all
customer_reviews.author: Seth Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it looks, how it feels. My first Citizen and EcoDrive. Charged up quickly with a little direct sunlight out of the box and it's working great so far. The strap that it comes with really is heinous, but in replaced it immediately and it looks great. Very quiet. I got it here on amazon on a deal for $100, and I feel like at that price point it's a fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: jkm

customer_reviews.title: Very good watch for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to replace my automatic Seiko that died a saltwater death ( ). (Once seawater gets inside a mechanical watch, its done.) The Citizen Eco-drive watch had a number of features that I liked, and very few that I didn't. I replaced the band with a metal bracelet, and its a great replacement. Accuracy is a few seconds a day. If the time is set correctly, I only have to fiddle with it at the end of each month.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good watch with some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: The watch quality is excellent but a couple issues: 1) the watch face is very small. 2) It's a pita to set the day and date. 3) The date will need to be fixed in months that are not 31 days long. 4) The band is lousy. It can be changed ... If you can live with these issues then it will be fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: NavH

customer_reviews.title: Quality Watch at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted this watch. When it went on sale recently, I jumped on it. I was not disappointed at all. The watch is a perfect size for an average-sized man's or woman's wrist. It is very readable in any lighting. The luminescent numbers glowed for a good amount of time. The movement isn't clunk, but it isn't smooth like some 21 jewel automatic watches. Beautiful face and band make this a watch I will wear in multiple settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W

customer_reviews.title: Never needs a battery!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very easy to read and fits well. Have to kinda break in the strap for awhile as it is pretty stiff while new, which makes it hard to attach when you first put it on, however, it is very comfortable while wearing it. I also had a few issues registering the watch with Citizen but their customer service is outstanding, 5 star to them, the customer Rep able to help me through the registration process and was very patient with me.
customer_reviews.author: DavidMassillonOh

customer_reviews.title: Replaced timex expedition version
customer_reviews.text: I bought the timex expedition version of this watch 3 months ago. The winding knob you change time and date with fell off yesterday. So i ordered this watch and overnighted it. It is obviously better built and looks and feels better too. It does seem to have a slimmer design. I had a citizen that solar cell died and went to times for the price point. I will not make this mistake again. I'm sticking with citizen from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and second hand lines up with the second marks.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing worse than paying $300 for a watch where the second hand falls halfway between the second marks, then to hear "that's to be expected in quartz analog movements". No it isn't, it's sloppy and this Citizen model just proved it can be done. Aside from that, this watch is comfortable, easy reading, and a great bargain. Love the canvas strap, but also nice to know if I want a different band I can replace it. All in all a winner after the other disappointments.
customer_reviews.author: g3gene

customer_reviews.title: Best Overall Daily Watch
customer_reviews.text: A great watch for daily wear. The movement is quartz so there are no precision issues plus the battery recharges with the solar panels in the dial so it never went dead. The build quality is great and the style is unassuming. The only major issue I had with it is the strap. I HATED it. I replaced it with a brown leather strap. That gave it more of a classic feel.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Vatnik

customer_reviews.title: Great watch when it works, I guess
customer_reviews.text: The glass was quite bang resistant, no scratches and didn't shatter on contact with hard surfaces. Size is compact and won't get in the way, fits great on tiny wrists. Band isn't very good but everyone replaces their bands, right? Lume is beautiful when it works and glows in all the right places (numbers, markers, all hands). Sad part is either quality or Amazon's stock... 1st one I got had the seconds consistently misalign to markers and Lume died suddenly, 2nd replacement was perfect except the day of the week dial snapped itself overnight...
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gift for my son
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch as a birthday gift for my son, and gave it to him while he was at camp in a leadership role (kind of like a CIT). It stayed on the whole time, including swimming, sailing, dodge ball, running around and other activities outside. It held up great! He said it was really useful as he had constant appointments and meetings and needed to be on time. He appreciates that it's solar powered. The hands glow in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Feiwu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is absolutely perfect for I was looking for. I have warn it every day for about a month and a half now. It was alil smaller than I anticipated, but I now consider it a good thing. This watch is easily visible, great illumination from the glow in the dark parts, and is highly accurate. My watch runs about one second fast each week, which I can easily recalibrate. After doing a lot of research before purchasing, I'm really glad I picked this one. BTW this watch does have dual language for day of the week and be sure to look up how to do it proper, which took me a few days to get right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Homestead

customer_reviews.title: TRULY A GEM OF A WATCH!
customer_reviews.text: The watch is military/field inspired. Simple design, easy to read with a day and date. It’s very accurate and easy to set up if you used watches before. What truly makes this watch stand out it’s that it’s solar powered! No need to worry about the battery for 10 plus years. This watch is perfect for work, camping, possibly even military use. It is extremely accurate (never take that for granted) most watches aren’t. A great watch for any type of emergency that requires timekeeping. The downsides are the bands (too stiff, ruff ) and the case is too polished for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Very nice watch, worth looking at.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good watch and it is very lightweight. The second hand aligns to the indices very well. It keeps accurate time to about 10 seconds per month. The band is well made and comfortable. My wrist is six and three-quarter inches in circumference and it looks a little small on me, but I still like it when I’m working in the yard and for activities where a larger watch would get in the way. I still wish this watch was a little larger, but if you are happy with the size, this is a great choice. I notice the price bumps between $89 and $129 pretty frequently, so be sure to watch for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lightweight Field Watch
customer_reviews.text: I went specifically looking for a lightweight, water resistant, and no-battery-required watch. While there are nicer/fancier/more expensive models out there, this one meets all of my needs and exceeded my expectations. I've had it for over a year now, with no worries about charging or swapping batteries. I also have not had to worry about when I do and don't wear it - it works equally well in the office and in the field. I have scratched the face a few times, but only minor scratches have resulted. If you're not looking for a watch to play dress up with or one that can tell you the air pressure in 3 separate time zones, this is an outstanding contender!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua W.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this because I love the Ecodrive line. Ibhave to say that this is better made than I expected. The band adjustments each have a metal gromet and the inside ofthe band is leather. Its a great time piece.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Best watch I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this watch for almost 7 years, and it has never failed to keep excellent time. It only needs resetting is for daylight savings time and months shorter than 31 days. I've worn it cutting down trees, shoveling snow, swimming, countless long bicycle rides. I've cleaned it up in the ultrasonic cleaner, and it looks as good as new. Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: sap

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality Watch, But Small Face and Narrow Band
customer_reviews.text: It is generally hard to tell the size of things when you look at a picture on a web site because for smaller objects like a watch, the picture is magnified. In this case it was magnified a lot. The small face and the narrow band relative to the normal size of a man's watch make this appear to be a woman's watch. It is comfortable to wear and the price was very good so I will keep it, but it is by far the smallest watch I own.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy1

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and no winding!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't take it scuba diving or snorkeling but light rain no problem, just dry it off when you get a chance. Not sure why but when I put on a watch I tend to bump into everything so it holds up well for the light bumps but it will scratch if you wack it hard enough but so will all watches. I don't wear it at work because it's nice and I want it to last it's a great watch and it's nice not having to wind it...
customer_reviews.author: ODB

customer_reviews.title: Nice lookin watch
customer_reviews.text: Nice lookin watch. I just received it so this is a premature review. If it fails in a in any way I will definitely do a follow up. My complaints are, the band sucks but I had already planned on getting a replacement (a nato) so no big deal. The luminescent dials fade relatively quick. I dunno a few hours. If you look hard you can still see them but I don't really care about that either because I don't live in a cave. I wanted a simple, decent looking analog watch and that's what I got. pretty happy thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Anne C

customer_reviews.title: Watch band runs small.
customer_reviews.text: The watch is fine but, watch band runs really small. Citizen should make the adjustable watch band holes fit 22 mm to 15mm. I can only get the last hole on watch band buckled. There seven adjustment holes on band (18mm to 11mm?). I'm not sure who the other holes are for. Children? Band quality is excellent. If they made adjustment holes in band to fit a range of wrist sizes like 22mm to 15mm this would be a 5 star review on the band. There just isn't enough band (at 18mm / last hole) left to tuck in, maybe 1/2 inch?. There is a 20mm citizen green canvas band on Amazon but, it is $38.00.
customer_reviews.author: R7

customer_reviews.title: Good watch that could be great with a sapphire crystal
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife who has long wanted a set-and-forget, reliable watch that is accurate, yet simple in design with a high degree of legibility. In short, this one fit the bill perfectly - she loves it! Also ordered two Barton straps so she can give the watch a bit of variety. [EDIT - 10 month update] Brand new, this watch looked so beautiful. But after 10 months (worn by my wife who works at a desk job) the glass-mineral crystal is so scratched it's difficult for her to read the time. As such, I cannot recommend this watch. Knowing what I know now, I only recommend watches with a sapphire crystal.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Watch stopped after fully charging then wearing for 3 weeks. Left on windowsill in sun for two days to charge, the watch stopped after continual wear after 3 months, can't change day of the week when trying to reset the time. Past the Amazon return date and manufacturer requested to send watch to repair center at my cost to evaluate. Going to send to Citizen but I wouldn't even want a replacement for this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: SLav

customer_reviews.title: Owned one of these for 10 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these about 10 years ago and it’s still going strong. It’s a lightweight watch that’s comfortable to wear. My only complaint is that the crystal sits exposed and I’ve broken it twice, so I wish there was a rim on the case that extended past the crystal for protection. Other than that, I’ve been really pleased with this watch,
customer_reviews.author: Browncoats Unite!Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: 20 months straight and going strong
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch back in July of 17 and have worn it every single day since. I've been through two bands but i am fine with that i enjoy changing them up anyways. I needed an everyday watch that was not going to break and was not so expensive that i would be worried about it. As a power plant operator this thing takes some abuse out in the field. I've also scuba dived with it (just down to 60 feet) with no issues. it also looks great and people are surprised at how inexpensive it was. 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Lohr

customer_reviews.title: One more reason to look forward to the weekend
customer_reviews.text: I own two other Citizen Eco-Drive watches and have been satisfied with each. With this one, I was looking to upgrade my weekend/travel/knocking around watch. I was considering one of the original Swiss Army watches (I had one of those years and years ago and loved it) but ultimately decided to see what was available in the Citizen line. This is perfect -- attractive, easy to read, simple and smaller than most of the watches you see these days. Many reviewers comment on the stiff band, but I don't find that a problem, and the number of holes in the band make it fit far better than my other canvass band Citizen.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Useless at night product
customer_reviews.text: This watch can be purchased for half the price since you cannot see it at night it has no light button and the glow disappears after 30 minutes so this watch is useless at night.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Fine utilitarian watch
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch to be a general knock around watch on the weekend. Picked it up during Xmas season as an amazon daily deal for $63.00. Great price for eco drive! Face is very readable. Lumes at 4 am are readable with my near 50 yo eyes. The case is smallish by today’s chunky standards however, this makes the watch less likely to knock into things. I knocked off one star for the cheap, stiff band. I immediately replaced with a cheap nato band and now have a 5 star watch!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Bagadonuts

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a solar watch with a smaller case to replace my current much larger watch and ended up with this Citizen. Pros: •Classic clean no frills look •Easy to set •Easy to read day/night • Price is unbeatable in its class Cons: •Strap uses grommets that are spaced 3/8” so getting a perfect fit isn’t possible for me •Case is shiny stainless steel. I prefer a gunmetal with no glint.
customer_reviews.author: Cam H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch, Horrible Band
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch if you're looking for a military inspired field watch. It's smaller than most of the other watches I own, and that's ok. I knew that when I bought it, and to tell you the truth, it's kind of refreshing not to have something big and clunky around my wrist. Easy to set, easy to read, and it's kept time perfectly. Like a lot of the other reviewers I found the band to be horrible. It's not bad looking, but doesn't flex much and is rather uncomfortable. Do yourself a favor and buy an 18mm band at the same time. I bought a silicone Barton band and it vastly improved the comfort of the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Wobbly Weeble

customer_reviews.title: Glass scratches very easily!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned quite a few watches in my time and I don't think I've ever had one with glass (or "crystal" as it's called in the industry) that scratches as easily as this watch. Not sure why this is. And, no, I don't work in rough environments or otherwise abuse the watch. Aside from the scratch-prone-ness, I love everything else about this watch. I've had it for about 2 1/2 months.
customer_reviews.author: deepblueday

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Great reliable watch I don't need to worry about the winding it up or change of battery. Looks better with Hirsch calfskin strap. I have slim wrists and this 37 mm case is perfect fit between men's and women's sizes. I used to wear Swiss Rado Sintra model but throw it out tired of stiff ceramic band hard to fine tune and small dial harder and harder to see for my older and older eyes. I believe it's a best buy for your money. Worth every penny even if not on sale but often it is.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C.Wisniowski

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof in heavy surf
customer_reviews.text: Based on two surf sessions the watch is waterproof while surfing in heavy surf. I like the casual, but solid look. I also really like that it's thin enough to comfortably fit under my wetsuit. The band is attractive and built well, but it has a couple of limitations when compared to the plastic band on my previous $10 vintage Casio digital watch. The band is less adjustable because of the ring hole design. The canvas band is largely waterproof but does retain a slight amount of moisture after surfing. This drys quickly when removed. In any case, I expected this tradeoff when I moved from my ugly watch to this nice watch.
customer_reviews.author: SeekingWisdom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Watch - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Only had the watch a week, but so far terrific.Very accurate; hasn't changed 1 second so far. Adjusts easily and performs as advertised. The real value of the Eco Drive will be how it performs over time; should be great. The band supplied is a different story. While attractive, it is very stiff and quite uncomfortable. The metal reinforcements around the holes are annoying. I've already had to change the band.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Sad premature failure
customer_reviews.text: I had given this watch a 5 star review after wearing it for a week but now after a few months I can no longer hold it in such high regards. I noticed on Monday that my watch said Sunday, I thought no big deal I must have somehow had the am and pm mixed but when I tried to change the day it got stuck and won’t move (see photo). I’m very disappointed because I really do like this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Alex J.

customer_reviews.title: Solid field watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. It's soo easy to read the time; a true field watch. Like the fact that it's solar as well. Luminesce could be better though. A <$30 Timex has better lume than this. Alot of people complain that the original strap/band is trash. It's decent for a original strap, not terrible quality. Yes, it's not soft at day 1 but I imagine after couple of months of regular use, it would be comfortable. I swapped it out for a Barton NATO strap on day 1 and I must say it compliments this watch well. It makes it look better imo.
customer_reviews.author: ATK

customer_reviews.title: This is my travel watch.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch. I had 1 for 7-8 years. Great for swimming, casual, it’s not expensive so don’t have worry about losing or damage. And it doesn’t need a battery. I sold my movado and kept this one. Wife bought me an Apple Watch which I use for work. I just had a motor bike accident and unfortunately my watch didn’t survive impact but it might of saved my wrist from serious damage. I will be repurchasing another 1.
customer_reviews.author: LV Blaze

customer_reviews.title: I love the watch. I hate the strap.
customer_reviews.text: The strap is the most uncomfortable I've ever used. Used exactly ONCE before replacing with a NATO strap. After a few months the watch has been very accurate. I only charge it for a little while every day under the LED powered nightstand lamp. So far that seems to be enough.
customer_reviews.author: H. A.

customer_reviews.title: The most perfect watch
customer_reviews.text: I've got several of these military style citizen watches and this is by far my favorite. It is just the right size with basic functionality. Well marked and easy to read dial with numbers that are luminous not just marks. Strap is easy to buckle and is built to last a long time. Like all analog clocks, the hands can get in front of the day and date. Also the luminous part is a little faint until your eyes have acclimated to the dark. Amazingly it is the least expensive of all the Ecodrive movements.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gasperi

customer_reviews.title: Incredible watch, timeless piece
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome watch, it is the best watch I have owned. The strap is very comfortable but very stiff at first, it breaks in super quick. I love the color and the face looks a lot better in person than in the pictures. If only my face looked that good... I am pleased with the functionality and this will be my every day watch supplanting my previous Citizen that I have wore daily since 1998. I love the Eco Drive feature, read my lips, no more batteries! Overall I totally recommend this watch as I may purchase a second so I have a back up in case this one fails over the next 2 decades!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sarasota

customer_reviews.title: Best everyday watch I've found yet
customer_reviews.text: Best everyday watch I've found yet. I did switch to a NATO style band. The one that comes with it is great, but was small even on my average sized wrist. I have scratched the crystal, but I literally wear it sailing, working in the yard, fishing, everywhere. It's not sapphire, but it's also not thousands of dollars and requiring hundreds of dollars in maintenance every few years. Case still looks great. Haven't had its long enough too evaluate battery, but others in these reviews have. Looking forward to years of no hassle use.
customer_reviews.author: RPN

customer_reviews.title: High quality, extremely light and accurate watch!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Citizen time piece! It's a very good looking watch! It's kind of military looking ! It's extremely light! It's also so easy to set the date and time you don't need the instructions! I strongly recommend this watch! A quality watch by a quality company with an excellent reputation!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Love the size, very nice watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch, first time in my 73 years I’ve paid more than $30-$40 for a watch. I will be honest, I was looking at Wenger or Victorianox but All they had were oversized monsters, I bought this watch simply because of the size, here is a picture of it on my Don Juan stainless band I’ve been wearing for 45 years. I dropped one star because the luminous dial is very faint, shines bright if you shine a light on it but fades quickly. Overall a very nice watch, maybe the last one I will ever have to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Elainen

product_meta.title: Citizen Eco-Drive Chandler Field Watch for Men, BM8180-03E
feature_bullets: LIGHT-POWERED ECO-DRIVE: Converts any light, whether natural or artificial, into energy. Energy is stored in a permanently rechargeable power cell. The watch recharges continuously in any light to run forever, with no battery changes required ever.

FOR YOUR ACTIVE LIFESTYLE: This Citizen silver-toned military watch has a stainless steel case, canvas strap, adjustable buckle closure, three-hand analog display with quartz movement, luminous hands and markers, a day-date display window, and a dial featuring hour markers and a minute track.

GUARANTEE & 5-YEAR WARRANTY: At Citizen, we stand by quality and craftsmanship. Every Citizen purchase comes with a 30-day money-back guarantee and a 5-year limited warranty so you can be sure your new Citizen timepiece meets your expectations.

WATER RESISTANT TO 100 M: This tactical watch is water resistant to 10 ATM (100 meters). In general, it’s suitable to wear in the shower, in professional marine activities like swimming and snorkeling, and in surface water sports, but not for scuba diving. Functions E101, 3 Hand, Day / Date
